description.narrative: GGF funds will support Sistemas Naturales y Desarollo, A.C. (SINADES) to implement its environmental education program. SINADES' education program, directed mainly to youth and women, utilizes the development of permaculture and organic food production to develop a culture of environmental ethics. The overall program consists of four subprograms. 1) The Youth and Children Environmental Education program is run in collaboration with kindergarten, primary, and secondary schools in El Pescadero and focuses on local marine and terrestrial biodiversity, environmental impacts of development, and global issues such as climate change. 2) The Solid Waste Management program aims to promote responsible consumption, recycling and reuse of materials, and environmentally sound waste disposal. 3) The Community Environmental Engagement program offers community members area to gather for array of environmental activities and is located in the newly constructed Community Center. 4) The Community Food Sovereignty program is a new program to promote family gardens and the implementation of alternative growing methods that allow for the production of organic food for self and family consumption.
